text: 22oz bottle. Dark pour with lots of bubbles and very fluffy milk shake head. Cocoa and licorice aroma. Sharp carbonation. Soda-ish body. Interesting.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Blackish pour with a frothy tan head. Notes of roast, licorice, light coffee, some ash and sweet dark dried fruits.

Bottle from the brewery. Pours dark brown with most no head. Tastes like chocolate malt, light booze, nutty, molasses, and light ash. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like chocolate malt, booze, nutty, m9olasses, and light ash.

4 oz taster draft as part of a 4 beer flight at the Westbrook Brewing Company in Mount Pleasant, South Carolina. The pour is darker brown with a small light tan head. The aroma is soft roast malt and some sweet light toffee. The taste is the roast malt and toffee caramel sweetness, clean and nicely balanced. The palate is medium to light bodied with active carbonation and dry mineral roast finish. Nice Schwarz.

Bottle; Pour is Cola Brown, with a fine bubbled beige head into this glass. Carbonation is modest but lively. I dont believe Westbrook is known for lagers - skepticism was high going into this one. This one has a heavier than expected smoky nose, with nutty undercurrents and mild fruit esters. The flavor profile falls flat here - muddled roasty notes move forward to bittering rye grain and feint cocoa. This beer excels at marketing, but I could do without it.

[8080-20160226] 650mL bottle. Roasted nutty grains aroma. Clear, dark black brown body with a medium-lasting foamy mocha head. Roasted nutty grains flavour. Full body. Good. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4
(c/o blankboy, w/ him, GregClow, jercraigs)
Overheard: "Youre victim blaming." "No, Im stupid blaming."

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - black pour with tiny beige head. Toasted malty aroma and taste, some caramel, cocoa, malty sweet into the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

fra fad
duft: ristet kant svag duft.
smag. lidt ristet svag kaffe svag chokolade

Tap @ Mig og Ølsnedkeren. Pours black with a medium creamy brown head. Aroma is malty, dark chocolate, some coffee, dark fruits, roast, light licorice. Taste is roasty, caramely, rye spice, burned wood, chocolate, malt, licorice. Nice schwarz!
From rap at Fermentoren. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, nuts, coffee and bitterness.
Pours a brownish-black color. Aroma of chocolate/coffee as well as a hint of nuts? Flavor of coffee, bittersweet chocolate and bit of caramel.

Bomber via beer world Kingston. On the verge of becoming a fridge lurker.. But Alex came thru an appeared at the house to hook up the monster table saw. Hooray. I do like me my Schwartzbiers. This here critter does the style some justice. DAABSTOAMPN, If you dont know what that means ... just kill yourself you anti Lebowski bastard. Glimmering with a low thin head. Lager tone abounds with dark mellow malts. Aint no roastyness in this critter. Soft. Like combing the desert... we aint found Sh*t. No stunt doubles were harmed in the consumption of this beer.

Dark brown coloured body with a two centimetre tall tan head, with the body showing about 60% opacity - not incredibly dark. Aroma of roasted malt, prunes, earth, cream and a touch of burnt metal. Medium-bodied; Thinnish feeling of roasted malt up front with some oatmeal and specialty grains noticeable, but the burnt flavours persist and ends with a hint of caramel sweetness. Aftertaste shows a bit of prunes alongside the earthy malt notes and ends with grain, oatmeal and some bitter fruit flavours. Overall, a decent beer, if that - much too thin and not enough complexity at all; Definitely below expectations, whatever they happened to be. I sampled this 65 cL bottle purchased from Murrays Cheese in New York (Greenwich Village), New York on 06-December-2015 for US$8,99 sampled at home in Washington on 29-March-2016. Bottled On Date of 09-October-2015.

[My bottle (650ml) shared with GregClow, jercraigs & mabel] Pours a dark brown with an average size lasting frothy tan head. Minimal lacing. Aroma of toasted malt, coffee, a hint of chocolate, very light hops, eggshells and rye malt. Only slightly watery flavour is malty along with a hint of nuts, notes of coffee & chocolate and light hops. Average bodied. Pretty good.

2016-02-26. Black body nice foamy tan head. 3++ Aroma is dry, dusty malt has a bit of cocoa like chocolate. Flavour is moderately bitter, dusty dry malt muted cocoa. Average bodied palate, soft effervescent carbonation. 3+ Okay, a bit milder than expected overall. 7/4/7/3/14-15 Bottle shared by Blankboy.
Dark black pour, smaller head. Huge roasted malt bill in aroma and taste. Lighter spice, chocolate. Medium body.

Poured from the tap into a pint glass. The appearance is a deep brown color with a large tan head. The aroma is big on malt with roasted malt and some spice tossed in for good measure. The flavor is spiced cocoa with hops mixed in. Overall a really interesting beer that I would drink again.

Bottle. Malty and roasty, a bit thin. Chocolate, rye bread. Next time I have this I will have to think of exactly the right time to have it - when I did have it was after a succession of stronger beers, and that is *not* the right time to have it.
Associated, Bushwick bottle: pours black with a tan head. Aroma is chocolate and rye. Nice light rye bitterness which mixes well with the chocolate. Nice slightly chewy body. Good.
Bottle shared by a friend. Darkest brown pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of malt and some chocolate. Malty flavor with lager yeast and chocolate accents before a roasty finish.

Pours a very dark brown with a taupe-tan head. Dark malt, some chocolate, and lactose on the nose. Full mouthfeel, but becomes thin and sharp. Coffee, dark malt, red fruit briefly in the middle, cola, and chocolate. Pretty dry all the way through.
Dark, clear root beer black-brown. Slightly sweet, mild roast aroma. A little vacant, mild roast, nutty sweetness, maybe a little cocoa. Body is a little watery. On tap, Just Tapd, Warner Robins.

Draft at the brewery The beer poured a deep black with no head and lacing. The aroma of chocolate and burnt malts greets you. The taste was full bodied with chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. The beer had a average carbonation. This is one of best I have of this style. The finish was nicely done with dry roasted malts closing out the beer. This was a birthday visit to the very successful Westbrook Brewery.
I see your schwartz is bigger than mine! .. . Dark brown black .. Good foam .. Dark malts, dark cereal, andctouchbofrye .. Nice mouth, pretty good black lager .. . . Bleeps, creeps

On tap @ Westbrook. Dark brown in color with a khaki head. Roasted malts and coffee grounds are prominent on the nose. Quite a bit more sweetness than I typically expect or prefer for this sort of beer. Molasses and brown sugar are particularly strong. Maybe some chocolate covered almonds? Decent carbonation.

Dark brown with charcoal tint and one finger of tan head. Nose shows toasted bread, earthy malt, a very light sweetness. Medium light bodied and soft carbonation. Spicy and earthy malt with an herbal note.
Bottle. Dark brown color. Aroma: malts, caramel, candy, dark bread. Taste: slightly sour, sweet caramel, halva, hoppy finish.

tt pours dark ground with a tan head. It has aromas of roasted malts and a touch of coffee. It has flavors of roasted malts, a hint of coffee, and slight hop bitterness. It has a medium body combined with high carbonation. It is mostly smooth and semi dry on the way down.

Medium-dark chocolate aroma, with some dark roast/char. Flavor is same with a little ash, prune, and roasted chestnut. Rye contributes a little spice/bready quality. Damn good dark lager but pretty pricey for the style.

How: Bottle (500 ml) at Mont-Carmel tasting. Shared by mathieuc, thanks! 

>>> A smooth and well balanced Schwarzbier that is pretty easy drinking. 

-  Clear amber-brown with a medium beige head and some lacing. 
-  All the flavors are well dosed, giving the beer a pretty good balance. 
-  Its tasty stuff and really easy drinking. 
-  Medium body and medium carbonation. Mouthfeel is a bit silky and finish is dry. 
-  I think I need to try some other Westbrook German-style beers as I liked their gose and this one a lot. 

Flavors:  Roasted malts, milk chocolate, cocoa powder, resinous notes, mineral presence, mild pine and mild caramel.

Pours a dark brown with a small offwhite head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of chicory and coffee. Dark indeed. Taste is of coffee with the slightest bit of ash (bummer). Both body and carbonation were moderate. Overall I thought it was pretty good for a schwarzbier. Maybe I need to seek out the better examples of the style now?

pours unclear dark brown with a frothy and creamy light beige cap, nice lacing. smoky burnt caramel, charred roasted maltiness - mineral but never ashy, some red berries, astringent and spicy woodsiness, pepper. average to light carbonation, light body - tad thin, balanced and lightly astringent, chalky and spicy finish. low-key lager fruitiness - beets but no kalamatas. ncie stuff anyhow.

Bottle shared. Clear deep brown black pour with white head. Aroma is nice and roasty, nice coffee aroma. Taste is really roasty, nice coffee flavor, burnt toast. Palate is light, dry and well carbed, very easy drinking.

courtesy of Thomas Schneider - dark brown beer with a decent head retention; toasted malty aroma with notes of dried fruits; a good malt backbone, light tart with notes of rye, clean toasted finish of figs and malts
Dark brown and almost clear. Has a light-brown head, lasting. Roasted aroma, chocolate, soysauce. Sweet flavor. Creamy
nice toasted,roasted aroma,black, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, coffee, dark chocolate, roasted bitter finish.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty and light hoppy aroma. Strong chocolate notes. Heavy bitter wonderfull chocolate flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.

Black with a thin ran head. Sweet malty aroma. Smooth and medium light bodied. Big malt flavors very little hopping

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark black, almost pitch, strong creamy tan head with very nice lacing. Aroma of malts, chocolate and roasted mostly with some rye. Taste low sweet caramel, bitter chocolate, roasted malt, some toasted nuttiness and bread, burnt bitterness in the finish. Dry roasted aftertaste. Medium to full bodied and creamy. More bitter and burnt than most Schwarzs, maybe a bit too much for the style.

22 oz bottle with a bottled on date stamp of 25 Sept. 2014. 
Pours very dark brown, looking nearly black and opaque in my snifter. 
The head is small but durable. 
The aroma is OK but certainly the weak point of this beer. The flavor and feel are both above average for style. Mildly bitter.

Kolsvart med litet huve som försvinner snabbt. Doften är söt vörtlimpa & kavring. Fantastisk smak av kavring eller tysk mört Vörtbröd, råglimpa, & kaffe samt söt med knäckebröds ton. Lätt i kropp. Enkel men komplex.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg. A cheeky little dance of smoothness and dark roasty bite. The rye is prominent, but youre quickly hypnotised by the gorgeous lacing. Then its gone. Good bitter end too. Great.
Pours a dark brown with tan head. Deep. Aroma was roasted malt, dark fruit, coffee and caramel. Taste followed and was silky smooth. Coffee upfront, creamy toffee and bitter on the end.

22oz bottle pours a murky, deep brown with some cloudy, off white head. Nose is mild but has some malt, some mild brown sugar, a little dark bread, pumpernickel, some mild yeast. Flavor has much more brown sugar, some turbinado sugar too, malty, bread, some mild chocolate, quite yeasty, some dark grains. Clean finish. Solid.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2015 On tap at The Bottle Shop Canterbury. Black beer lasting tan head. Soft dark lager with attractive dark chocolate notes. Its rather delicious slightly bitter dry finish. I rather liked it

Pours a porter brown with a tan head. Nose is rye, malt, and earth with hints of lager yeast. Flavor is similar with rye, malt, earth, and lager yeast. Light to medium in body and lingering yeasty finish.

Tap. Pours black with deep amber shine and creamy one finger brown head. Aeoma is dark malts, dark chocolate, coffe beans and subtle dark fruits. Some burnt sugar. Taste is really roasty, medium sweet along some caramel and smooth grainy rye spice. Light crisp body and long roasty finish with dey coffee and bitter dark chocolate.
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2015 Bomber. Pours a black color with beige head. Burnt, roasty, ashy, rye aromas. Burnt, ashy, spicy, burnt toast flavors. Pretty nice.

Bottled 650ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Black coloured, small beige head, roasty nose. Roasted malt, chocolate, light caramel and touch of hops with nutty notes in mild roasty finish. Not the best representative of the style but glad to have tried American Schwarzbier. 6.0%ABV.

650ml bottle. Black colour with average to huge, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, brown head. Sweet-ish, chocolately, dark malty aroma, hints of treacle, a touch of liquorice, roasty dark malty and minimally metallic hoppy overtones. Taste is dry, roasty dark malty, notes of dark chocolate, hints of malt lozenge and treacle lend some sweetness; lasting, roasty finish. Oh yes!

Christmas present, this one was good, roasty, light,
Lightly hoppy, very well made

Bottle. Pours deep black with a small, creamy beige film head. Aroma has chocolate, hard roasted malts, soft black currants. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good roasted malts, chocolate, coffee. Absolutely lovely.

Bottle shared by RussianDragon.

Near black body, appearing mahogany at the edges. Small tan collar that leaves a touch of lacing in its wake. Aromas of chocolate, char, smoke - though not on the level of a rauchbier. Dark toast, a hint of dark fruit. Lager yeast and rye bread come in mid to late palate. Solid.

22 oz bottle brought back by Andy, many thanks! Pours a translucent brown nearing black with a tan finger of foam that settles to nothing. Aroma is mild and sweet with a hint of rye. Flavor is same with a certain metallic tang near the finish. Thin bodied, medium carbonation, bitter rye lager finish.

Dark and nearly opaque, but definitively brown rather than black. Dark khaki head. Dry, nutty, roasty aroma. Im not sure how to describe this one. Creamy and smooth, but with a strong, complex, grainy character. Bitter, roasty, spicy. Coffee and peanut butter notes. Medium sweetness. Black coffee-like bitterness in the finish. Tasty and unique. Slightly overly bitter, but thats my one complaint. Very interesting and pleasant. This could go very well with food.
Tap. Aroma and flavor are pretty porter/stout...chocolate and smokey but way toned down. Super drinkable though.

22 ounce bottle. Pours almost black with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, caramel, and a touch of smoke. Does have the lager crispness. Pretty good.

Pours a deep brownish black on tap with dissipating tan head that leaves great lace. Aroma is dark chocolate and deep roast, hint of lager crispness. Taste follows, clean roast and chocolate, smooth carbonation and clean finish. Good stuff for the style.

22 oz bottle. 6.0%. Bottled on 9/23/14. (The Greenville Beer Exchange) Greenville, SC.
Black colour with a small tan head. 
Dark roasted malt, coffee, mild sweetness and some hops in the aroma. 
The flavour is roasted malt, strong hops, bitterness and coffee. Much stronger, hoppier and more roasted than the German ones. Good beer though but not true to original German Schwarzbier.
Schwarzes Bier mit schöner beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Schokolade, Röstmalz und Kaffee. Geschmack sehr schokoladig, Kaffee, süß röstmalzig.

Dunkel malziger, leicht röstiger Antrunk. Würzig, aufkommende Schokoladennoten. Ab dem Mittelteil etwas herber, die Malzigkeit bleibt süffig Angst intensiv, leichte Espressonoten. Rundes würziges Bier. 9/10/11/11/11/11
Bottle. Red dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, roasted malt. Flavour is roasted malt, rye, coffee, salt, licorice, chocolate. Medium body. OK beer.
Black pour. Small creamy tan head. Lacing. Huge roasted coffee and chocolate aroma. Taste is a creamy roasted grain with a milky chocolate finish. Slightly bitter finish.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Clear, dark, reddy brown. Film of tan head. Chocolate malt. Roast grain. Hint of spice. A little vanilla. Taste is roast dry. A little dark chocolate sweetness. Smooth, fairly rich palate. Finish is lager yeast dry, with a little roast bitterness. Wasnt sure at first, but I warmed to this one. Overall score marked down due the top dollar price tag...

Ive generally stopped buying beer in bombers, but this is Westbrook and their other beers earned this a go. Extremely dark. Flavors are basically a stout on lager yeast. Big roast. Almost a touch of ash. Good beer.

Dark/thin black color. Nice roasted malt aromas, with some chocolate.
Nice session-able body. Light roasted taste. Some chocolate and coffee with an easy aftertaste. Very nice beer.

65 cl bottle. Bottled on 22.10.2013.
Pours dark red, almost black color with a small head. Very malty on the nose, roasty, some wooden notes, dark chocolate and some faint smoky notes. Malty and roasty flavor also, dark chocolate, dried fruits, some faint hops. Very pleasant and balanced, yet another success from Westbrook. The half year age doesnt really feel on this one. Nice.
4425

650 ml bottle. Pours a black colour with a beige head. Aroma of roastiness, cream, chocolate and some coffee. Rich flavour of roastiness, dark bitter chocolate, sour cream, bread and grassy bitterness. Medium bodied and very smooth mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Well done, tasty as hell.

Bottle. Pours dark Brown. Im a wee bit surprised by this one. Obviously the reference to Space Balls is excellent but I paid a lot of money for this bottle and it was a pretty underwhelming experience. I could have bought about 5 equally tasty Czech Tmavys for the same price. Im surprised that Ratebeer backs up its lofty price with an impressive score. I might be being a bit unfair. It was after all, very nice but Im awash with Tmavys here and this one is comparbale and by no mean spectacular.

Strange beer, 650ml bottled 12/10/12 which may be just a bit too old to give a fair chance, Id be very interested to try this fresh. Pours dark brown with little head tastes like a mild/porter with a dash of macrolager. Plenty of roast malt, chocolate. Its not a bad beer by any means.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours dark brown, thin beige head. Aromas of malt extract, rye spice. Taste is clean and malty sweet. Bit thin on the finish.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours black, roasty chocolate nose, light smoke, taste is dry, smoky sausage, sweet chocolate, bitter.
bottle at homre ... deep black ... thin tan head ... soft dark sweet roast nose ... dark roast ... crystal malts ... sweet roast ,., soft toffee roast
Dark black body with a thin tan head. Aroma is malty chocolate with hints of coffee. Sweet taste with some bitterness. Quite fizzy which gives a spicy feel in the mouth.

Poured from 22 oz. bottle. 

Opaque, near black with a tan head and good lacing. 

Aroma of toasted malt, chocolate and grain. 

Taste of chocolate, toasted malt, yeast, rye and orange. 

Medium body and high carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear dark brown, brown minimal head
Roasted malts, caramel, toffee, licorice, burned wood
Very drinkable, hops finish, astringency due to roasted malts, some chocolate, some ashes, cocoa bean, a hint of licorice
Bottle via trade. Pours a dark brown with minimal head. Aroma is very grainy with some chocolate. Taste is similar with some peppery notes. Good beer.
Bottle share thanks to Homer. Pours black, aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste is mild coffee and a bit bitter. Light flavor, very drinkable.

Pours dark brown no head
Aromas pale chocolate, caramel, asphalt
Taste has roasted malts, chocolate, burned bread

Pours very dark brown with almost no head. Aroma is rye bread, brown sugar, chocolate, roasted malts, slight vanilla. Taste is brown sugar, chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla, caramel. Mouthfeel is smooth with low carbonation. Aftertaste is roasted malts, chocolate.

Pours dark brown with low tan head. Aroma of smoke, german sausage, chocolate malts. Taste is bitter, smoky, coffee. Body is fairly light with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Pours clear deep brown with a huge, frothy to lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, yeast and rye notes. Sweet flavor that end up dry with a hint of bitterness. Medium bodied, oily texture an soft carbonation. A very nice Schwartz.
At BBF. Black colour with beuge head. Roasted, coffee aroma. Roasted, coffee taste, slightly metallic. Light body.
Black colour. Roasted malt, chocolate aromas. Flavour is simailar as aroma, bittersweet.
On tap at Barcelona Beer Festival 2014. Dark red color. Head is thin. Body is medium. Aroma is coffee, roast and light fruit.

Bottle courtesy of PaulUnwin. Pours a porter brown with a tan head. Nose is rye, malt, and earth with hints of lager yeast. Flavor is similar with rye, malt, earth, and lager yeast. Light to medium in body and lingering yeasty finish.

Bottle, 22oz. Its a dark reddish brown beer topped by a dense, finger-thick beige head leaving lacings. The aroma has toffee, some chocolate and roasted malts and a faint note of corn. Dark bread as well. The flavor has the same chocolate and toffee, with roasted malts, dark rye bred and some faint notes of corn. Semi-sweet on the palate, with a nice carbonation level. Roasted finish with chocolate and some salty hints. Not very true to style this one, but nice and tasteful anyway. Complex in a subtle way. 140315

Bottle 650ml @ home
Pours clear dark reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, rye and toasted bread. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a roasted and chocolate finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

For a swartzbier pretty good. Nice chocolate flavors come through with nice hop bitterness. Sweet profile. Slight chalk common in this style but less than many. Overall nice beer good mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Maxi. Very dark brown, small off white head, some lacing. Aroma and taste, roasted malts, quite hoppy, chocolate, caramel, brown sugar. Lively carbonation. Bitter sweet aftertaste, with roasted notes. Dry mouth feel.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small off-white head. Aroma of coffee, bread, pumpernickel, ash and light fruity yeast esters. Taste is very light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of coffee, ash and bread. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice but very roasted.
Pours a murky brown with no head. Aroma of malt, banana esters, pineapple. Taste is light, malty, banana esters. Very light, but not a great flavor. Not great.

So I used to think this was not my favorite brewery in Charleston - too much german influence- but the past couple of brews (one claw and this) have pretty much changed my mind. This is exceptional. Pours a jet black with a decent head. Carbonation appears to be low. Nose is coffee, chocolate and maybe some smoke? Body is medium to heavy (heavier than I would expect for a lager) and totally, totally smooth. Taste is same as nose but the rye definitely comes through for me- even at only 10% of the brew. Adds a really nice subtle note. Finish is smooth but lingering. The best kind. Really excellent brew. Will be visiting brewery next time I am in CHS.
Aroma: toasted malts. Appearance: black, small white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: smoked flavours, dry malts. Overall: decent Schwarzbier. Pint at Euston Tap, London.

Keg at the Euston Tap, 15/01/14.
Light black with a good sized faded tan head that dissipates to a covering and edgework.
Nose is dark malts, sweet tones, earthy cocoa backdrop, toffee fudge, soft brown bread dough.
Taste comprises cocoa powder, dark toffee fudge, a sweet lead schwarz, muscavado sugars, hint of dark fruits.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, sweet closure.
Nice schwarz, pretty sweet but well balanced, a pint of this would likely be a little too much for my palate but a half is fine.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 22oz bottle in a tulip. Pours very dark brown with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of roasted and chocolate malts, some light rye, a little dough and pale malts, and some light hops. Flavor the same with a decent blend of everything. Average texture. A good beer for the style.

Bomber from Whole Foods in Greenville. Oily black-ish pour with a thin tan head and sparse soapy lacing. Aroma is roasted malt and muted coffee/chocolate. Tastes are cocoa, coffee, chocolate - all well balanced. Also a little bready, black pepper and just a hint of licorice (which is good by me). Oily palate and lightly bitter finish. Interesting for sure - though might not need more than once.

Tap at the Jeffrey Pours very pretty dark brown with lovely head of coffee milkshake with great legs. Nose is light cola and chocolate. Tastes of dark chocolate, earth, espresso, chalk, ring pops, and cream. Velvety and smooth.
Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours opaque dark brown with a slight layer of light tan head. Aroma of slight chocolate and hints of malts. Taste, again, mostly of chocolate and malts.

Pours almost black with a thick head and long lasting lacing. Nose is of chocolate against a slightly sweet background with a hint of smoke. I could not detect any rye or hops in the nose. Light medium bodied and a smooth mouthfeel. Balanced carbonation typical of a lager. The taste is a fine balance of chocolate against a slightly sweet background with a tick of rye and smoke. An undertone of coffee is also present. Smooth finish of chocolate with a light rye spiciness and smoke that lingers. The lingering finish is where the coffee flavor is most evident. Very impressive.

22oz bomber from a trade. Poured a solid pitch black body with s smaller foamybeige head. Dusty chocolate aroma, pudding skins, well done toast, slight espresso, roasty, some vanilla extract. Fuller bodied with lighter
 Carbonation and a lingering aftertaste. Flavor is light coffee notes, dark toast, roast, lolipops, grains, vanilla extract, burnt notes. Solid

Pours a deep, warm coffee brown with a thick and rather persistent fine-bubbled tan head. Woody aroma has notes of coffee, semi-sweet chocolate, hay and caramel. Robust flavor has bold coffee, caramel, woody hop, and subtle licorice and horehound notes. Texture is smooth and fairly fizzy. Get your dark helmet on!

12/11/13. 22oz bottle from Five Points. Deep brown pour, almost black, with a nice khaki head that sticks. Toasty aroma, malty, biscuit and caramel, with a bit of roast, coffee, and chocolate. Nice flavor, smooth maltiness that is more chocolate forward than the aroma led on, a hint of fruitiness, plenty of roast, some ash, lingering biscuit and chocolate. Tasty!
Great reference to a ridiculous movie. Nice toasty grain and roasty malt flavors. Pours a light black with a thick brown head. Finish has some light citrus hop notes. Decent to style beer.

Finally a Spaceballs beer. Space black pour with khaki ring and nice lacing. Nose of coffee, chocolate, deeply roasted malts, and nuts. The taste adds a tiny note of dark fruit. rye bread herbal bitterness at the finish. Clean and velvety feel.

Bottle thanks to SSSteve, thanks!. Pours black with some light brown head that stays at a dense brown ring. Nose is chocolates, roasted malts, and some various sweet bready malts. Flavor is toasty biscuit, chocolate, and breads. Medium full body velvety and good.
Bottle. Black with small beige head. Smooth and velvety palate. Roasty. Stout like. Some chalkiness.

Bottle from Sweet Grass Dairy. Deep brown almost black pour with a small bubbly white head. Aroma of roasted malts, light cocoa and touches of smokiness and prunes. Roasted malt, light chocolate, with touches of smoke and a metallic, alkaline ending. Light in body, prickly carbonation and very drinkable. Not bad.

From 22oz bomber. Pours a dark brown with tan head. Deep. Aroma was roasted malt, dark fruit, coffee and caramel. Taste followed and was silky smooth. Coffee upfront, creamy toffee and bitter on the end. Rye was a nice touch.

22 ounce bottle - $8.99 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Bottled on: 10/22/13.

Appearance: Pours a near (very near) black body with just under an inch of sandy beige foam.

Smell: Chilled coffee and less-than-sweet chocolate wrapped in a thin layer of clean, worksafe smokiness. Ashen grains. Bruised grapes.

Taste: Roast, bakers chocolate, and a subtle rye quality. Coffee-toned. A little sweet present, but, not overly so. Pinch of ashes (a bit smokey). Faint licorice. Grape-y dark fruitiness. Scant hop character but some light bitterness showing. Semi-dry, roasty finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation. Smooth, soft texture.

Overall: Being notably fuller in all its regards it is not exactly a classic, traditional schwartz. Still, its a reasonably nice beer. Cant we just like nice beers?

Draft at high dive. Deep black color .malty drinkable and cocoa with a a crisp back bite.eh

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hmm an interesting alternative - a craft Schwartzbier out of South Carolina. The aroma is distinctive and smells like burnt rye bread. Taste again features rye bread as well as roasted coffee/ cocoa. Very smooth and drinkable, although the finish is both sweet and sour and thus a bit confusing. In summary, "Hearty" is the word that comes to mind. As a star wars and spaceballs I also enjoy the labelling.---Rated via Beer Buddy

Sample at the Beers from the Bikes Villes tasting on 11/08/2013. The beer is a solid black color with a medium beige head that diminishes gradually. Small patches of lacing. Malt, citrus and hops in the nose. Light to medium body with a roasty character of malt and chocolate, along with some citrusy hops and licorice in the background. The finish is sweet with a roast malt aftertaste. Decent overall.

bottle, from Wholefoods Woodruff, Greenville SC. good aroma, sweet. Malty, roasty, cocoa, little bread, dark blackish brown color, good head and lace. sweet bitter flavor. medium body, creamy thick mouthfeel, bitter finish, yet kind of smooth. Pretty good. falls a little short of being great, not sure if rye cuts into roasted malts usual flavor, getting more of the yeast as it warms, Solid , enjoyable, not one Id buy a bunch of, but good to try
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Smells very much like chocolate stout...but almost in a bad way...hatd to rate appearance...very malty and roasted little hops

Pours very dark, mostly black with a little brown on the edges and a bubbly khaki head. Nice roasty and slightly spicy nose, toffee, creamy milk chocolate, and some subtle dark fruit notes. Nice creamy mouthfeel, roasty coffee notes, light chocolate notes, somewhat bitter spicy character from the rye, and just a trace of smoke. Really well made, delicious and smooth.

Keg at CBI, London on 16th June 2013. Black with tan head and almost no lace. Rich berries, fruitcake and roasty aroma. Rich roast malts in-mouth with tanginess. Grassy and tangy flavours in finish with touches of smoke. Zingy mouthfeel and solid body. A good mouthful!

Bottle. Black colour with a beige head with good duration and medium lasting. Arome has notes of peat, toasted malts and light coffee. Flavor is dominated by black coffee, chocolate, toasty, peat and slightly ashes. The final is slightly bittery with a good duration.

Bottle @ Christers. Pours dark brown with light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruits. Flavor is malts, chocolate, light licorice, dark fruits, plums. Medium body, soft carbonation. 030713
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Almost black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt and chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 030713
Bottle. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, hop, medium sweet, little liquorice and medium bitter.
Okay schwarzbier. IT is prettythick and black for the style, not really an easy-drinker.
Tap at Crowbar, april 30th 2013. Black body, big brown head. Malty caramel aroma, light toast. Taste is malty with chocolate, banana, grass with a slightly roasty finish. Sweet chocolate aftertaste.
Roasted malt, very smooth mouthful with low carbonation, dry fruits and herbacious hops. Nice schwarzbier.

Solid black body with bubble beige ring head. Fresh compost nose with fig sweet highlights. Despite a decent undercurrent of carbonation this is a sooth a sipping Schwarz as Ive enjoyed. Initial wrap of molasses and cream with the softest coffee. An initially shy roast shimmys onto the palate. Subtle and grainy at first, but thick leathery bitter whips on the finish. Carbonation leaves a mild dryness more picnic table wood than anything too offensive. 
Keg, Craft Beer Co., Islington
Pours black with a dense beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, sour notes, dark fruit and herbal hop. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit, malt acidic, liquorish and herbal hop.
Pours black with creamy head, aroma is sweet caramel with a herbal notes. Roasted malt with caramel and chocolate notes, a slight bitterness is also present.

On tap at Crowbar. Very dark, almost black, with a beige head. Malty aroma with some roasty notes, licorice, chocolate and some hoppy notes and citrus. Moderate sweet and malty with a dry and quite bitter finish. Nice and refreshing!
On tap at Christian Firtal. Black with a lasting tan head. Aroma of caramel and licorice with herbal and spicy hop notes. Sweet licorice and malt flavour with roasted notes
Tap @ Chr. Firtal. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, milk chocolate, nuts and hops.

Mini-growler from the Piggly Wiggly, North Charleston. Nice dark brown pour, very rich carbonation with mild chalky sediment. Chocolate malts in the nose with an understated roastiness and mild bitter notes. Medium bodied, fairly lively without being overdone. Bitter and grassy in places without losing the density and richness of the chocolate character, and sharp in the finish where it needs to be. Well done overall, and nicely tasty.

Bottle shared at CP&K. It pours near black with a small tan head. The nose is earth, roasted malt, spice and umami notes. The taste is toast, light roast, earth, coffee, spice, light treacle and nice level of bitterness with a dry finish. Light-medium body and moderate carbonation. A pretty tasty Schwarz.
Bottle shared with Scopey. Pours black with a thin ram head with little lacing. Aroma is leather, malt, smoke, chocolate, malt. Palate is light and dry.

decent roasty grain aroma. gorgeous dark brown.black with off white head. flavor was malty, a bit dusty, some woody notes. finish was dry as would be expected. kinda thin in the middle though, so wasnt thrilled with this one.

29th March 2013Bottle purchased at Euston Tap and shared with Leighton and the Craft Clerkenwell crew. Opaque dark brown beer, little pale tan head. Palate is light, crisp and dry. Light touch of dark malt with a little unsweet dark chocolate. Trace of dark fruits. Light dry finish.

Bottle shared at CBC Clerkenwell - London. Big thanks to Ken for sharing. Great stuff. Coffee, some light earth, leather, dirt, moderate darkly toasted malt sweetness. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Modest dry bitter finish, further earth, hints of chocolate. Nice.
22oz bottle. Poured a dark brown color with an off white head. Aromas of roast, chocolate, and some rye breadiness. Tastes of the same.
Bottle @ home....It pours clear black with a medium tan head... The aroma is roasted malt and some chocolate..... The flavor is roasted malt, light coffee and chocolate....bitter finish....

Draught @ Brickstore. Super roasted malts with a nice smooth mouthfeel. I could see coming back to this again and again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
on tap, dark brown to garnet colored pour,  coffee and some dark walnut shell, roasty, smoke or rye notes, light finish
Thanks Doug, I style I like.  This one somewhat coffeeish and dry, like an Irish stout.  Some smoke.  Black with reddish highlights and lacy.
Dark brown color with a slight head. Somewhat boozy aroma, some coffee and rye hop bitter. Dry lingering aftertaste, with noticeable alcohol
Pours deep brown with a slight tan head.  Sweet malty aroma.  Taste is roasted malt,  coffee,  chocolate. Easy drinking, smooth mouthfeel. Nice warming feel.
22 oz Bottle. nice beer. good body and great mouthfeel. Nice finish. Malty  roastiness with a balanced bitterness. Wish this beer were available in Virginia.
Draft.  Poured dark brown with a smallish light tan head.  Aroma and flavor were roasted malt, some rye and noble hop spiciness, caramel, light chocolate and smoke.  Medium palate.  Quite nice.

Draft at Charleston Beer Works. Pours an opaque coffee brown with a big frothy tan head. Aroma is massive chocolate and nuts and not much else. Maybe some earth and toast. Flavor hits the same notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation that fluffs in the mouth a little. Toasty. Rich. Tasty.

A bold beer great for a cold month.  Excellent malty nose with strong chocolate character and yet, hint of vanilla.  Light on palette for its weight but leaves with a full mouth feel.  Highly recommended on tap.

Bottle from my parents.  From Growlers.  Dark pour with a tan head.  Aroma is a little rye spice, lots of coffee, chocolate, and a little ash.  Taste is a more pronounced rye, chocolate, and green coffee.  Bottle artwork is amazing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home.
pitch dark, gigantic foamy light brown head that settles relatively quickly.roasted malty notes, woody citrussy note, could be infected, it was a little lively when opened.Quite complex aroma with notes of cocoa beans, coffe beans too. nice. Flavor is warming, cocoa, roasted malts, finest chocolate, very nice subtle chilies like bitterness, things play very well together, and it is not at all infected in any way.unusual and very flavorfull and tasty beer, lots of taste for the 5.9% abv. Quite not like Your usual schwarzbier, but very drinkable, very enjoyable
Botella. Black colour with a red hue, brown head.Aroma of dark fruits and roasty malt. Roasty malty and dark fruity pleasant flavour with some chocolate. Pleasant bitterness.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2013 Retasted with exact same score. This time not really overcarbonated and perhaps with a little more hops?
08-MAR-2013, bottle @Sonni, @Ulkløbben tasting.
************
27-AUG-2012, bottle @Papsø.
Clear, dar, dark brown with huge brown head.
Yeast and bitter hops. Roast.
Rye bread, like a rye schwartzbier...
Huge carbonation (as usual with Westbrook).

Bottle at Papsø. 
Clear red-brown coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Fruity aroma of dark chocolate and spices.
Fruity and light roasted flavour of dark chocolate and licorice.
Light roasted finish.
Very carbonated.

Bottle, 65 cl, at Papsø. Reddish black with a dense beige head. Breadish, light roasted nose. Very smooth mouthfeel, nice roasted flavor, bready, quite dry, slightly ashy finish. Some plummy and chocolately notes. Medium body.

Bottled  A pitch black beer with a huge lazing dark brown head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, and bread. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, bread, and caramel, leading to a dry bready finish.

Bottle 65 cl. Pours an almost clear orangey brown with a huge and lively beige head leaving quite some lacework. Dusty, roasty aroma. Medium body, overly carbonated. Heavily roasted, almost scorched. Malty bitter finish. 270812

22 fl oz bottle. Pours dark brown with a deep amber glare and small tan head. Aroma is toasted malty and caramelish. Dry dark malty and breadish. Dark roasted. High carbonation. Ends dry and dark roasted malty.

Botled. Dark brown coloured. Dense beige head. Aroma of light roast, caramel, vague yeast, some chocolate. Flavour of caramel, light roast, some citrus, cocoa, grass, chocolate. Medium bodied. Ends on a light roasted bitterness. Nice.

Bottle 22fl.oz. @ home on the terrace.ABV: 6.0%. Clear dark brown colour with a huge, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, light beige to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, chocolate, sweet berry, moderate yeasty, yeast - sweet rye. Initial flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter, finish flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, roasted bitter, cold coffee - chocolate. Body is medium, texture is oily, initial carbonation is fizzy, finish carbonation is soft. [20120711]

Bomber bought @ Ølbutikken. Pours dark brown with a huge frothy and fizzy brownish white head that slowly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is sweet, malty and spicy with rye flour, black pepper, dry wood, baking soda, lemon zest, cocoa powder, caraway, baking yeast and very subtle hints of banana bread. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty with dark rye bread, cocoa powder, biscuits, peppermints, black pepper, liquorice root, caraway, wood, burnt brazil nuts and hints of lemon zest. Mouthfeel is fizzy, very smooth, slightly dry and light to medium bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and bitter with rye bread, cocoa powder, dry wood, black pepper, plums, biscuits and hints of cookie dough.

(Bottle) Pours black with a pale nougat coloured head. The aroma holds rye bread, dough, spices, mint, chocolate, touch of coffee and a whisper of baking powder. Hints of flowers and fruits. The flavour is light sweet, light to medium bitter and light acidic with notes of minty/spicy/bready rye, coffee roasted malt and citric/herbal/earthy hops. The mouthfeel is soft, silky and round with a full, lively carbonation. Burned, light milky and a bit spicy numbing finish. Medium bodied.

Bottle. Very high and long lasting creamy light brown head. Pitch black body. Spicy coffee barley malt aroma. Strangely the first impression is of citrus. Second impression is choccolat, roasted malt and hops. Apart from that the beer is having a lot of carbonation and a long and very pleasant hops finish.
Sweet and fruity. The smoke is fresh. No hops. Very carbonated. Nice on, high drinkability.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty caramel aroma with hints of chocolate. Roasted malty caramel and chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty caramel finish with hints of chocolate.

Bottle at home. Pours jet black with a huge bubbly beige head. Seems highly carbonated. The aroma is light plastic like with notes of hard roasted malt and light chocolate. The flavour is mostly roasted with some fruity and chocolate notes. Quite roasted finish.

Bottle at home. Clear very dark brown - offwhite head. Chocolate, cacao, dry dusty cacao, rather high malty, light fruity, roasted malts, light soapy, light off notes, super high carbonation upon opening. light spicy, nice cacao/chocolate drink.... Not a schwarzbier.

Date: March 14, 2012
Mode: Bottle
Source: Greenville Beer Exchange
Appearance: black, frothy tan head, sudsy lace
Aroma: big roasted aroma, light sweetness
Body: highly carbonated body
Flavor: rich roasted flavor, bitter dark chocolate, slight burnt character
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 11/20
Rating: 3/5.0Drinkability: 6/10
Score: ** /4

Bottle Pours black with a huge, frothy, cappuccino head that never fully dissipates. The aroma is straight-up café con leche accompanied by a big hunk of fudge. Very, very nice. Full-bodied with a silky mouthfeel and dancing carbonation. The flavor is of unsweetened dark chocolate, espresso and a touch of carbonic charcoal. Finishes crisp, burnt, moderately bitter, and then presents a lingering, spicy dryness. Borderline world class beer. Terrific for a Schwarzbier. Bottle generously provided by ElliesBrown.  Zacks good people!
Poured from 22oz bottle.  Pours dark brown with too much head...this thing was a gusher.  Aroma is rye spices.  Taste is roasted malts and some spice.  Meh...

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a thin beige head. Rye malty aroma, with lightly roasted malts and a hint of chocolate. The flavor has rye and lightly roasted malts, and a light chocolate sweetness. Nice.
Bottle courtesynof Ken, thank you sir!  Black color, brown head. Aroma of roasted coffe and chocolate. Taste is similar. Hi carbonation interferes with the flavor somewhat. Still pretty tasty.

22 ounce bottle that poured a black color with aromas of roasted malt, earth, chocolate, caramel, and some bread.  Flavors of some smoked malt with rye bread dipped in some chocolate.  Interesting flavors overall, decent offering from Westbrook, they continue to surprise me.

Bottle at Maxs Tasting. Pours a deep mahogany brown with frothy brown lacing. Aroma is sweet caramel malts, light wet wood, light roasted chocolate. Mouthfeel is thin with notes of watery chocolate, roast, smoke, wet dog, and sweet roasted caramel malts.

Bomber from Charleston Beer Exchange. HUGE burst of carbonation as the bottle was opened but it didnt gush. Pours a very dark brown, nearly black, with a large frothy tan head. Average head retention. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, floral notes, faint toastiness and rye. The taste is chocolate and roasted malts, rye, nutty notes and a mildly hoppy finish. Thin-medium bodied, very dry and VERY highly carbonated. I think this would be much better without so much carbonation.

Pours a deep brown with a fluffy tan head. Nose and taste are sweet and malty. Not a style I am a huge fan of but a solid beer nonetheless. Fun beer to pop at a tasting for the novelty if nothin else.
Bottle pours a brown/black with a large foamy tan head. Scent is rye, chocolate and dark sugar. Taste is rye, chocolate and a hint of smoke. Nice

Bottle. Pours deep, dark brown with thin tan head; decent retention and some lacing. Aroma is grain, toasted malt, rye, dark fruit, and light smoke. Flavor is mostly dry malt, light caramel, light smoke, and faint earthy hops. Medium body and carbonation with low warmth.

Bottle.  Pours clear black with a small, fizzy tan head, short retention with light lacing.  Aroma is caramel, chocolate and toast malt with dates and earthy esters.  Flavor is malt dominant with licorice, dates, chocolate and toast malt and a dry finish.  Medium body, warmth and carbonation.
Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Nose/taste of rye bread, chocolate, coffee and smoked black malt. Medium body. Soft carbonation.  Solid offering.
Very malty taste with heavy carbonation. Smell is malt, dark fruits, smoke. Really solid beer that is best savored. Impressive!

On tap at Grapevine.  Pours out a dark brown color with a tan head on it.  Smell is malty and has a good bit of chocolate in it.  From the smell I would expect it to be very thick.  It is not; very light and easy to drink.  High carbonation, really quality schwarzbier and the first of this brewer for me.
